edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common
Class LSPTerm

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPObject
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPTerm
public class LSPTerm
extends LSPObject

Represents a STARTS "term", as described by the specification. A term is a major data object used throughout SDARTS, in LSPFilter, LSPRanking, and elsewhere. A term can consist of a field (LSPField), zero or more modifiers (LSPModifier), and a value LSPValue). Or, it can be zero or more modifiers plus one value. So, in plain English, that means a term can also be just one value.

A term can have a weight associated with it, but this really only has meaning if the term is being used inside an LSPRanking

Constructor Detail

LSPTerm

public LSPTerm()
Creates an empty term. Note that this is technically an illegal state for the term to be in, so it should be populated as soon as possible using the various set . . .() methods.
